metadata.title: CVE-2022-1586 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds read vulnerability was discovered in the PCRE2 library inthe compile_xclass_matchingpath() function of the pcre2_jit_compile.c file.This involves a unicode property matching issue in JIT-compiled regularexpressions. The issue occurs because the character was not fully read incase-less matching within JIT.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1586` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre2-16-0 - 10.31-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
libpcre2-32-0 - 10.31-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
libpcre2-8-0 - 10.31-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
libpcre2-posix0 - 10.31-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
pcre2-utils - 10.31-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pcre2 package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.31-2ubuntu0.1~esm1').
